ART102~Design~4~A study of design is the unifying foundation for the visual arts. Two- and three-dimensional projects demonstrate theory and application of basic design elements and principles.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None
ART107~Drawing~4~Introduction to foundational drawing from direct observation
column3: and reference. Traditional and experimental media and methods are explored to develop technical and formal skills in support of individual expression.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None

column1: ART118~Painting I~4~Introduction to observational and experimental approaches and techniques in acrylic or oil painting. Color theory
column4: and individual expression are emphasized.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None

column1: ART221~Sculpture I~4~An introduction to sculpture and three-dimensional design through the exploration of the inherent properties of various materials and processes.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None
ART231~Pre-Columbian
column3: & Contemporary Mexican Art~4~This course aims to develop an understanding and appreciation of Mexican art from the Pre-Columbian
column6: with emphasis on Frida Kahlo and the muralist movement of Diego Rivera
column8: and José Clemente Orozco. Students will participate in numerous excursions to many museums as well as archaeological and historical sites.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None

column1: ART240~Art History Survey~4~A survey of art of the Western world from prehistoric to modern times.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None

column1: ART244~History of Architecture after 1750~4~History of architecture and city planning since 1750
column2: as illustrated by Western and non-Western examples.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): None

column1: ART249~The Designed Environment~4~This course addresses the designed environment
column4: and urban design. Class sessions consist almost exclusively of extensive walking tours and site visits to prominent examples of design excellence.~Core Curriculum Component: Engaging Minneapolis

column1: ART290~Native American Art~4~An exploration of the rich heritage of visual arts from indigenous communities of North America

column4: and Western concepts of art. Students will meet Native artists
column5: visit a variety of Native American art galleries and exhibitions
column8: and political context surrounding Native American art.~Core Curriculum Component: Fine Arts~Prerequisite(s): 1 of ENL111(Effective Writing)
